page.title: 08North Watford Library
page.content: It is used each week by over 1000 people. Anyone who lives or works or goes to school in the area is entitled to join. There is a staff of 20 including part time workers. The age range of people who use the library is from 2 to 90 years of age. The library has a bookstock of 58,656. The most popular books with children under 8 years of age are picture books especially the books of Janet and Allan Ahlberg. Novels tend to be read more by women than men, the most popular being those by Catherine Cookson. The library has a variety of activities including a family reading group and storytime for the under 5s. The library is open for four and a half days a week. The busiest times of the year are during the school holidays.
